description: Travel back in time and experience the journey of America’s immigrants! This workshop combines live performance and archival film footage to explore immigration stories from the 1800s and 1900s.

title: Weekly Food Recovery Initiative
description:
Join our weekly Food Recovery events, where dedicated volunteers and members gather to make a difference in our community. Each week, participants help collect perfectly good leftover food from Gourmet Dining and transport it to Blanton. There, the food is repackaged into individual microwavable containers and stocked in the food pantry, providing meals for those in need throughout the week.  
 To Participate : RSVP to attend the event each week. Meet in Blanton Hall Residence Hall Kitchenette in the Communal Area (Tell them you are working with Food Recovery), Sign in via Event Pass and your set! 
 Requirements: 
 
 Volunteers must be Food Safe Certified to participate. 
 Complete the certification by following the step-by-step instructions provided in this  link . 
 Once certified, email your certification to  foodrecoverynetwork@sgamsu.org  to confirm your eligibility to participate. 
 
 Your involvement helps reduce food waste and insecurity while supporting individuals in our community who are in need. We look forward to your participation! *Please Note: This event end time is dependent on the amount of food given. You can estimate for max of hour and a half for recoveries.

title: Chess Club SB Meeting!
description: Chess club student body meeting! Come play chess and socialize with your fellow members! Chessboards will be provided; come at your convenience!

title: On View: The Age of Black Metal by Afrotectopia
description:
Embark on your own interstellar voyage in  The Age of Black Metal  by Afrotectopia. Admission is free, open to the public. 
   
 Segal Gallery 
 Tuesday – Friday, 12 – 4 pm 
   
 Kasser Lobby 
 Monday – Friday, 12 – 6 pm 
   
 We're also open on select Saturdays of the month and  by appointment . 
   
 About the Exhibition: 
 On view through December 14, 2025 
 Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
   
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way.

description: The Black Student Union is an RSO dedicated to providing students with a safe space on campus. Our general body meetings are welcoming spaces focused on connection, support, and empowerment, while encouraging open dialogue, collaboration, and most importantly, community.

title: Free Swim Lessons - *Beginner*
description:
Never swam before? No problem! These lessons will give you the important foundational skills in swimming and help you be more comfortable in the pool. Learn how to use proper breath control, float, and swim with a kickboard.  
 Skills Focus: 
 
 Being comfortable in the water 
 Learning how to float on your back and front 
 Learning how to kick off the wall with a kickboard 
 Introducing proper breath control in the water 
 Learning how to tread water 
 Learn alternate kicks (Froggy Kick) 
 Being comfortable in the deep end  
 Introducing arms to your strokes 
 
 How do I Sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 When and Where? 
 
 From 09/8 - 11/20, 2025 
 Tuesday, 5-6 p.m. 
 Student Recreation Center - Pool

title: The Apple Core Community General Body Meeting
Award Winners Exhibition
description:
The Department of Art & Design is proud to present the  Award Winners Exhibition . 
   
 The exhibition will be on view in Finley Gallery from  November 7 through December 1, 2025 , with an opening reception on  Wednesday, November 12, from 2:00–4:00 PM . 
   
 Finley Gallery will showcase a curated selection of works that highlight the artistry, hard work, and commitment of these emerging creators, offering an inspiring glimpse into the diverse ideas and approaches shaping our students’ practices. 
   
 We invite the public to join us for a reception at Finley Gallery on Wednesday, November 12, to celebrate the accomplishments of these talented makers and the bright futures ahead of them. 
   
 Exhibiting artists include: Jelena Wall (Illustration), winner of the Donald and Judy Miller Scholarship, the Cento Amici Scholarship, and the Ina Golub Scholarship Brett Diese (Visual Communication Design), Dean’s Advisory Board Award and Ina Golub Scholarship Bralen Jones (Visual Arts), Richard Carboni Thesis Materials Award Marlena Holston (Visual Arts), Richard Carboni Thesis Materials Award Santiago Arcila (Visual Arts), Richard Carboni Thesis Materials Award Ashley Ortiz (Illustration), Cento Amici Award Sabrina Saroza (Visual Arts and Art Education), Cento Amici Award Camila Garcia (Visual Communication Design), Dean’s Advisory Board Award Giacomo Valerin (Visual Arts), recognized for Outstanding Work in Integrative Studio I Mari Ahmed (Visual Arts), recognized for Outstanding Work in Integrative Studio I Maurice Tobias (Visual Arts), recognized for Outstanding Work in Integrative Studio II Sadie Vizcaino (Visual Arts), recognized for Outstanding Work in Integrative Studio II Kelly Arita (Visual Arts), recognized for Outstanding Work in Integrative Studio II Jivon Batres (Visual Arts), recognized for Outstanding Thesis in Integrative Studio III 
   
 Scholarship Winners Exhibition Finley Gallery, Finley Hall Exhibition dates: November 7–December 1, 2025 Reception: Wednesday, November 12, 2025, 2:00–4:00 PM

title: Strategic Communication and Media (MA) Virtual Information Session
description:
Build a Career Where Strategy Meets Influence    
 The communication landscape is evolving—and skilled professionals who understand how to shape messages, manage platforms, and drive engagement are more valuable than ever. 
 Our  MA in Strategic Communication & Media  is designed to help you grow into leadership roles where strategy, creativity, and influence converge.  Join us for a virtual information session on November 18 at 7:00 PM (EST) to learn more.  
 This is your opportunity to meet faculty, ask questions, and discover how our program can align with your goals—on your schedule, with your priorities in mind.

title: Model UN Simulation — Second Meeting
organization: Montclair State University Model United Nations
description: This meeting continues our two-part Model UN simulation. Delegates will present their policy statements, debate resolutions, and finalize draft clauses. Attendance is required for all participants involved in the first session.
